xQueueHandle buffers

Detailed Description

Protocol stack main module.

Protocol stack main module: handling of the buffer/event queue, buffer management

Open bus for stack event messages.

portCHAR stack_check_broadcast (  address_t  address,
addrtype_t  type
) 
 

Check if all the bytes in the address field are 0xff

Parameters:
address The address field to check
type The address type (so that the function knows how many bytes to check)
Returns:
pdFALSE Not a broadcast address

pdTRUE A brodcast address

sockaddr_t *  a2
) 
 

Convert addresses to full format if fields are missing.

Compare two addresses

Parameters:
a1 first address to compare
a2 second address to compare
Returns:
pdTRUE match

pdFALSE no match

Initialize protocol stack and start stack task. Allocate initial set of buffers.

Returns:
pdTRUE

uint8_t* stack_insert_address_to_buffer (  uint8_t *  dptr,
addrtype_t  type,
address_t  address
) 
 

Add an address to a given buffer

Parameters:
dptr Index to the data field of the buffer where to insert the address
type Type of the address (ADDR_802_15_4_PAN_LONG, ADDR_802_15_4_LONG, ADDR_802_15_4_PAN_SHORT or ADDR_802_15_4_SHORT)
address The actual address structure

start_status_t stack_start (  stack_init_t *  stack_parameters  ) 
 

Initialize protocol stack logical type.

Parameters:
stack_parameters pointer for start parameters, 0 start stack on the default mode.
Returns:
START_SUCCESS when start parameters are valid.

CHANNEL_NOT_SUPPORTED when given parameter is not valid.

TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED when logical type is not supported.
